lairs.name: A half-sunken grotto beneath the city
Derelict ship, anchored in the canal

crew.assassin-rigging:
[/load 2 free load] Weapon or Gear items

For example, carry a pistol (a weapon) and burglary tools (gear) for zero load
crew.bravos-rigging:
[/load 2 free load] Weapon or Armor items

For example, carry a sword and pistol or wear normal armor for zero load
crew.cult-rigging:
[/load 2 free load] Document or Arcane Implement items

For example, carry a profane book of curses and a demon's hand for zero load
crew.thief-rigging:
[/load 2 free load] Tool or Gear items

For example, carry burglary gear and tinkering tools for zero load
crew.hawker-rigging: [/load 1 free load] *Concealed* even against a patdown
crew.smuggler-rigging: Two of your carried items are *concealed* even against a pat down
crew.elite-skulks: Skulks Cohorts get [/dice +1] to *Quality Rolls* for Skulk-related actions
crew.elite-thugs: Thugs Cohorts get [/dice +1] to *Quality Rolls* for Thug-related actions
crew.elite-rooks: Rooks Cohorts get [/dice +1] to *Quality Rolls* for Rook-related actions
crew.elite-rovers: Rovers Cohorts get [/dice +1] to *Quality Rolls* for Rover-related actions
crew.elite-adepts: Adepts Cohorts get [/dice +1] to *Quality Rolls* for Adept-related actions
crew.ironhook-contacts: You have [/tier +1 Tier] in prison. This counts for any Tier-related element in prison, including the incarceration roll
crew.ritual-sanctum-in-lair: A sacred and arcane workshop for occult practices and rituals
crew.hardened: Each PC gets [/trauma +1 Trauma Box] and may bring a PC with 4 *Trauma* back into play. This costs three upgrades to unlock
crew.ordained: Each PC gets [/trauma +1 Trauma Box] and may bring a PC with 4 *Trauma* back into play. This costs three upgrades to unlock
crew.composed: Each PC gets [/stress +1 Stress Box] This costs three upgrades to unlock
crew.steady: Each PC gets [/stress +1 Stress Box] This costs three upgrades to unlock
crew.underground-maps-and-passkeys: You have easy passage through the underground canals, tunnels, and basements of the city
crew.camouflage: Your vehicles are perfectly concealed when at rest. They blend in as part of the environment, or as an uninteresting civilian vehicle (your choice)
crew.barge: You can move your lair to a new location as a *Downtime Activity

lair.boat-house:
You have a boat, a dock on a waterway, and a small shack for storing boating supplies

A second upgrade improves the boat with armor and more cargo capacity
lair.carriage-house:
You have a carriage, two goats to pull it, and a stable. A second upgrade improves the carriage with armor and larger, swifter goats

Horses are very rare in Duskwallâ€”most carriages in the city use the large Akorosian goat as their draft animal
lair.hidden-lair: Your Lair is in a secret, hidden location. If it's discovered, use two *Downtime Activities* and pay [/coin Coin] equal to your *Tier* to relocate it and hide it again
lair.quarters:
Your Lair includes living quarters for the Crew.

Without this upgrade, each PC sleeps elsewhere, and is vulnerable when they do so
lair.secure-lair:
Your Lair has locks, alarms, and traps to thwart intruders. A second upgrade improves the defenses to include arcane measures that work against Spirits

Roll your Crew's *Tier* if these measures are ever put to the test to see how well they thwart an intruder
lair.vault:
Your Lair has a secure vault, increasing the Crew's storage capacity for *Coin* to 8. A separate part of your vault can be used as a holding cell

A second upgrade increases the capacity to 16
lair.workshop:
Your Lair has a workshop appointed with tools for tinkering and alchemy, as well as a small library of books, documents, and maps

You may accomplish long-term projects with these assets without leaving your Lair

training.insight: Earn [/xp 2 XP] instead of 1 when you train **Insight** during Downtime
training.prowess: Earn [/xp 2 XP] instead of 1 when you train **Prowess** during Downtime
training.resolve: Earn [/xp 2 XP] instead of 1 when you train **Resolve** during Downtime
training.personal: Earn [/xp 2 XP] instead of 1 when you train **Playbook** during Downtime
training.mastery:
The PCs gain access to master level training. You may advance your *Action Ratings* to 4

This costs four upgrades to unlock

quality.documents: Improves the *Quality Rating* of the Crew's Documents
quality.gear: Improves the *Quality Rating* of the Crew's Burglary Gear and Climbing Gear
quality.implements: Improves the *Quality Rating* of the Crew's Arcane Implements
quality.supplies: Improves the *Quality Rating* of the Crew's Subterfuge Supplies
quality.tools: Improves the *Quality Rating* of the Crew's Demolitions Tools and Tinkering Tools
quality.weapons: Improves the *Quality Rating* of the Crew's Weapons

harm.name: Broken
harm.description: Can't do anything until they recover

harm.name: Dead
harm.description: Destroyed. Spend [/coin Coin] equal to your *Tier* +2 to restore it

edges.name: Independent
edges.description: Can make good decisions and act on their own

edges.name: Loyal
edges.description: Can't be bribed or turned against you

edges.name: Tenacious
edges.description: Won't be deterred from a task

flaws.name: Principled
flaws.description: Has an ethic or values that it won't betray

flaws.name: Unreliable
flaws.description: Not always available, due to other obligations

vehicleEdges.name: Nimble
vehicleEdges.description: The vehicle handles easily. Consider this an assist for tricky maneuvers

vehicleEdges.name: Simple
vehicleEdges.description: The vehicle is easy to repair. Remove all of its harm during downtime

vehicleEdges.name: Sturdy
vehicleEdges.description: The vehicle keeps operating even when broken

vehicleFlaws.name: Costly
vehicleFlaws.description: The vehicle costs [/coin 1 Coin] per Downtime to keep in operation

vehicleFlaws.name: Distinct
vehicleFlaws.description: The vehicle has memorable features. Take +1 *Heat* when you use it on a Score

vehicleFlaws.name: Finicky
vehicleFlaws.description: The vehicle has quirks that only one person understands. When operated without them, it has [/dice -1] *Quality*

districts.name: Brightstone
districts.blurb: The grand mansions and luxury shops of the wealthy elite.

districts.name: Charterhall
districts.blurb: The city's civic offices and the hub for shops, artisans, and commerce.

districts.name: Six Towers
districts.blurb: A formerly rich district, now worn down and dilapidated.

districts.name: Silkshore
districts.blurb: The 'red lamp district' and artist community.

districts.name: Nightmarket
districts.blurb: The trade center for exotic goods imported by rail. Many vendors also trade in illicit goods.

districts.name: Crow's Foot
districts.blurb: A cramped neighborhood of multi-level streets, ruled by gangs.

districts.name: The Docks
districts.blurb: Rough taverns, tattoo parlors, fighting pits, and warehouses.

districts.name: Barrowcleft
districts.blurb: Residences and markets for the farmers who work the fields and eeleries.

districts.name: Coalridge
districts.blurb: The remnants of Duskwall's original hilltop mining settlement, now home to laborers and industrial factories.

districts.name: Charhollow
districts.blurb: A maze of tenements and squalid row houses.

districts.name: Dunslough
districts.blurb: A labor camp served by convicts and a ghetto for the destitute poor.
